definition: variant of 頂呱呱|顶呱呱[ding3 gua1 gua1]
variant of 頂呱呱|顶呱呱[ding3 gua1 gua1]

sentences.english: The wind has blown apples down.
The wind bit with a sharper edge and I turned toward my home.
sentences.chinese: 風颳如刀割，我開始掉頭回家。

sentences.english: The wind blew hard all night but let up at daybreak .
sentences.chinese: 整個晚上風颳很厲害，但到破曉時風勢減弱了。

sentences.english: But when the wind blows,You feel it on gour face.
sentences.chinese: 但是風颳，你在臉表面上感覺到它。

sentences.english: The wind is blowing hard; please see to that all the windows are fastened properly.
sentences.chinese: 颳大風了，請務必把所有的窗子都關好。

sentences.english: This gust wind be pared off, our a lot of people possibility will fade.
sentences.chinese: 這陣風颳來，我們好多人可能就會凋謝。
昨日整天颳大風下大雨。

sentences.english: I think there will be a strong wind.
When blizzard comes in winter, we can only stay at home all day long.
sentences.chinese: 冬天颳大風雪時，我們只能整天呆在家中。

sentences.english: Now the "Just Dance" diva is influencing fashion with her wide-brimmed hats and leotards.
sentences.chinese: 現在她的寬邊帽和緊身衣又一陣風颳到了時尚界。

sentences.english: The fierce wind raved itself out.
sentences.chinese: 狂風颳過一陣以後停息下來。

sentences.english: It's been very windy these last few days.
World Cup fever has spread to South African grannies, with dozens of elderly women in aprons and skirts fighting for the ball.
sentences.chinese: 世界盃的旋風颳到了南非的一羣老奶奶身上。

sentences.english: Sit the voice namely pares off ashore the cordless wire to blare at the north air namely can hear an outdoor in the home.
sentences.chinese: 坐在家裏可以聽見外面的北風颳在電線上嗚嗚的聲音。

sentences.english: We were dizzy by the strong wind.
sentences.chinese: 我們被大風颳的頭暈目眩。

sentences.english: To the outside of a throw, confetti with scraping fly immediately disappear without a trace.
sentences.chinese: 到室外一拋，紙屑立即隨風颳飛不知去向。

definition: a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
sea breeze/sea wind (i.e. from the sea)
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
slightly cold/cool/(neologism) (slang) to be done for/about to be obliterated/(of a place or a person) desolate
